class MultiMediaEditorDocument

Detailed Description

Contains a variable number of compound items, which are aligned horizontally by the ParagraphCompoundItem. Note that every ParagraphCompoundItem contains at least one TextCompoundItem with
as last character to indicate the end of a paragraph.

BOOLEAN ParagraphCompoundItem::InsertCompoundItem (  CompoundItem *  item,
INT  ci_index = -1
) 
 

Inserts a compound-item, which has to be created by CompoundItem::CreateInstance(), into the paragraph. The paragraph takes care about splitting, merging and deleting compound-items by CompoundItem::ReleaseInstance(), hence the pointer to every passed compound-item might be invalid after invoking InsertCompoundItem (e. g. when inserting the content of the compound-item might be merged to the previous compound-item and the inserted compound-item will be deleted immediatly).

Inserting a paragraph inside a paragraph is not allowed and FALSE is returned. To insert a paragraph into the document use MultiMediaEditorDocument::InsertCompoundItem.

Parameters:
comp_item Compound-item, which should be inserted.
ci_index Index of the compound-item, which will be the successor of the compound-item comp_item. If the index is smaller than 0, the compound-item will be appended at the end of the document.
Returns:
TRUE, if the insert-process has been successful.

BOOLEAN ParagraphCompoundItem::InsertCompoundItemBeforeItem (  CompoundItem *  comp_item,
INT  item_index = -1
)  [virtual]
 

Inserts a compound-item into the paragraph. In opposite to InsertCompoundItem the compound-item can be inserted before a variable item, not only before a compound-item. The paragraph takes care about splitting, merging and deleting compound-items by CompoundItem::ReleaseInstance(), hence the pointer to every passed compound-item might be invalid after invoking InsertCompoundItemBeforeItem (e. g. when inserting the content of the compound-item might be merged to the previous compound-item and the inserted compound-item will be deleted immediatly).

Inserting a paragraph inside a paragraph is not allowed and FALSE is returned. To insert a paragraph into the document use MultiMediaEditorDocument::InsertCompoundItemBeforeItem.

Parameters:
comp_item Compound-item, which should be inserted.
item_index Index of the item, which will be the successor of the compound-item comp_item. If the index is smaller than 0, the Compound-Item will be appended at the end of the paragraph.
Returns:
TRUE, if the insert-process has been successful.

Removes the compound item with the given index.

Parameters:
ci_index Index of the compound item, which should be removed. If the index is smaller than 0, the last compound item will be deleted.

void ParagraphCompoundItem::SetBottomLineGap (  UINT8  gap  )  [inline]
 

Every line of a paragraph may have a gap on bottom of the line. Per default the gap is set to 0.

void ParagraphCompoundItem::SetLineAlignment (  LineAlignment  alignment  )  [inline]
 

Sets the line alignment for the paragraph. See also EditorDocument::GetLineAlignment.

void ParagraphCompoundItem::SetTopLineGap (  UINT8  gap  )  [inline]
 

Every line of a paragraph may have a gap on top of the line. Per default the gap is set to 0.
